historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already safely above 0.75 but is fading (dA/dt<0) while diversity is slightly collapsing, so I’ll keep U near the best-record value yet slightly boost agency sustain by reducing k_A_decay and modestly relieve diversity pressure by lowering k_D_decay.

A is already >0.75 but is slowly fading (dA/dt=-0.0016) while C and D are high, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value and reduce agency decay slightly to stabilize A without disrupting the current high-complexity/high-diversity regime (last change at Gen 50 had negligible impact).

A is already >0.75 but fading with D collapsing, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing diversity/agency decay (reversing the earlier k_A_decay increase and easing k_D_decay) to flip dD/dt and dA/dt positive without adding selection pressure (k_DU stays minimal).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0) while C and D are slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and make a small corrective tweak to reduce A-decay and D-decay without increasing selection pressure (k_DU), avoiding the past large k_A_decay change that caused a big drop at Gen 120.1.

Agency is already >0.75 but is slightly fading alongside complexity decay, so I’ll stay near the best-record regime (U=0.10) while reducing decay terms (notably k_A_decay, which previously caused a big drop when mis-set at Gen 120) to flip dA/dt positive and stabilize C/A.

A is already far above 0.75 but all derivatives are negative, so I’ll largely revert/stay near the best-record settings (U=0.10) and make a small sustaining tweak by reducing k_A_decay slightly (past k_A_decay changes had the biggest impact) while easing D’s collapse by lowering k_D_decay a bit.

A is already far above the 0.75 objective but is slightly fading (dA/dt < 0), and past large changes to k_A_decay caused a big drop (Gen 120.1), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value and make a very small reduction in k_A_decay to stabilize A without destabilizing C/D.

A is already >0.75 but is slowly fading (dA/dt<0) alongside decaying C, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while taking a calculated stabilizing step by lowering k_A_decay slightly (past tweaks to k_A_decay sometimes helped and we want to arrest the drift without disrupting high D).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=+0.0015) while current U/params match the best record, so I’ll keep U steady and make a small stabilizing tweak to counter the slight complexity decay without risking a destabilizing phase shift (noting past k_A_decay changes sometimes harmed A).

name: Decay-Tuned Agency Weaver
description: This agent crossed the threshold by repeatedly fine-tuning its loss terms—especially k_A_decay and k_D_decay—so Agency could accumulate instead of bleeding off, with most parameter updates producing net gains across the run. It emerged in a relatively gentle environment (U=0.10) by maintaining high Diversity (0.954) and solid Complexity (0.833), using strong A–U coupling (k_AU=0.99) and moderate C–D coupling (k_CD=0.48) to convert environmental signal into action while keeping decay low enough to avoid instability.
